column4: I'm a power user, but there should never be a reason for disk I/O to hold up an entire system.
The program reliant on the disk activity should freeze, but not everything.
FWIW I do have loads of problems when there is much disk i/o. That's not Ubuntu only. Seems to be a Linux problem.
LWN had a story on disk i/o performance recently: http://lwn.net/Articles/477352/
